commit_message:
Handle volume not found on zfssa volume delete

The zfssa driver doesn't handle cases where a volume may not
exist on the backend when a delete call is sent.  The result
is a stack-trace in the logs, sometimes a crash of the service
and an inability to clean up volumes from Cinder's perspective.

This patch doesn't address the root cause of the issue, but
it does handle the case more gracefully by catching the
exception, logging an error and returning.

This way the volume can be cleaned up on the Cinder side and
the operator still has an indication that something went wrong.
This is a common pattern for most of the drivers in Cinder.

Change-Id: I09725b29effb79450d010949527bd54329919f52
Closes-Bug: #1472412

commit_message:
Add petitboot boot driver support

This design spec introduces the petitboot boot
driver support for OpenPOWER servers in ironic.

Change-Id: I5da4dd080b3329aea64123b6e769edb5157c993d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/41/177641/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================== FSP OPC driver ==================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/fsp-opc-driver This blueprint proposes adding new driver that supports deploy Interface and management Interface for OpenPower little endian servers. Problem description =================== OpenPower little endian servers use ``petitboot`` loader which is very similar to the standard pxe behaviour. But, there is some difference like: * ``opc``(Open Power Controller) driver will not download any netboot loader, as ``petitboot`` is already in the firmware of FSP(flexible service processor). * The format of ``petitboot`` configuration file is different from the ``pxelinuc.cfg`` and more kernel command line parameter will be passed. When the FSP is running in OPAL(Open Power Abstract Layer) mode, the operation is very similar to IPMI. But the management operations ``set_boot_device`` can not work as timeout raw code is not supported by FSP. Proposed change =============== * Add new directory ``opc`` in ``ironic.drivers.modules`` * Add new file ``deploy.py``, ``management.py`` in ``ironic.drivers.modules.opc``. * Add new file ``petitboot_config.template`` in ``ironic.drivers.modules.opc`` The format of template will be :: default deploy label deploy kernel ``{{ kernel_path }}`` initrd ``{{ initrd_path }}`` append ``{{ parameter }}`` label boot_partition kernel ``{{ kernel_path }}`` initrd ``{{ initrd_path }}`` append ``{{ parameter }}`` * Configuration options for ``petitboot`` config template :: [pxe] #petitboot_config_template=<template path> * Create PetitbootDeploy Class inherit from PXEDeploy class. Override the method below: - ``deploy()`` - ``petitboot`` can use dhcp 209 option for the conf file. When 209 option and ``bootfile`` is not given, ``petitboot`` will request ``/pxelinux.cfg/mac-conf-file``. As ``dnsmasq`` may not support 209 option, so ``opc`` driver will disable the ``bootfile`` in dhcp option. - ``prepare()`` - ``petitboot`` will add ``/`` prefix before the ``kernel_path`` and ``initrd_path`` in tftp request automatically, so ``opc`` driver will add ``tftpboot`` prefix before ``kernel_path`` and ``initrd_path`` to avoid tftp mapping rule conflict. The format of conf file will like :: kernel ``tftpboot/<node_uuid>/kernel`` initrd ``tftpboot/<node_uuid>/initrd`` * Create OpcManagement class inherit from IPMIManagement class. - ``set_boot_device()`` - Do not send timeout raw code. I have no idea about how to deal with this tiny change. Any advice is welcome. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ None Security impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Scalability impact ------------------ None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: chenglch <chenglch@cn.ibm.com> Other contributors: baiyuan <bybai@cn.ibm.com> Work Items ---------- * Add new opc_fsp driver, extending deploy and management interface APIs. * Writing and unit-test cases for opc_fsp driver. * Writing configuration documents. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit-tests will be implemented for new opc_fsp driver. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== The default behavior of this driver remains compatible with ipmitool.IPMIManagement and pxe.PXEDeploy. Documentation Impact ==================== Writing documents to instruct operators how to use Ironic with opc driver. References ========== [1] - ``Netbooting with petitboot``: http://jk.ozlabs.org/blog/post/158/netbooting-petitboot/

commit_message:
Add hook to create a context from the headers

Adds a hook to parse the HTTP headers and turn them into a
Neutron context. The context is then attached to the thread-local
request object so future hooks and the controller can operate on it.

Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch
Change-Id: I982f7dc7f736c2b3539dffcf81c4ad141434b68f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/52/191052/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: hooks.ExceptionTranslationHook(), # priority 100 hooks.ContextHook(), # priority 95

subject: Fix accessing shared policies, add assoc tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-26 13:04:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d980f626bfc3a8e6b98f17c635685a33ec031719', 'message': "Fix accessing shared policies, add assoc tests

This patch is two-fold:
1. Previously, policies that were created using the 'shared=True' flag
   were not accessible to other tenants, since the context used to
   search the policies was not elevated. This patch elevates the context
   prior to retrieving the policy, and if a match was found, makes sure
   that the user has permissions to access it (either the policy is
   shared or it's from the same tenant id).
2. Tests for both associations and disassociations of policies to both
   networks and ports are added in this patch, to make sure coverage is
   good and that the problem is fixed.

Change-Id: Idec13ff4ec575b6d0c0a455c1b3bd9d9700ff7fb

commit_message:
Fix accessing shared policies, add assoc tests

This patch is two-fold:
1. Previously, policies that were created using the 'shared=True' flag
   were not accessible to other tenants, since the context used to
   search the policies was not elevated. This patch elevates the context
   prior to retrieving the policy, and if a match was found, makes sure
   that the user has permissions to access it (either the policy is
   shared or it's from the same tenant id).
2. Tests for both associations and disassociations of policies to both
   networks and ports are added in this patch, to make sure coverage is
   good and that the problem is fixed.

Change-Id: Idec13ff4ec575b6d0c0a455c1b3bd9d9700ff7fb

added_lines: # We want to get the policy regardless of its tenant id. We'll make # sure the tenant has permission to access the policy later on. context = context.elevated() if (policy_obj and not policy_obj.shared and policy_obj.tenant_id != context.tenant_id): policy_obj = None

There is no such field anyway.

commit_message:
freezer-scheduler without api service

Add the ability to start the freezer-scheduler without any
OS identity variable when used with the parameter

  --no-api

In that case the scheduler loads the configuration files for
the jobs from local files with the extension .conf located
in the directory

  /etc/freezer/scheduler/conf.d

The default path can be changed using the parameter

  --conf

Change-Id: I7787fa1af24a71600b3f483a770053226fec2191

commit_message:
add api endpoint /v1/health to support HAProxy

The following endpoint is added to the api service:

   /v1/health

It does not require any authentication. It simply sends back
a succesfull empty reply to be used tipically by a HAProxy

Implements blueprint: haproxy-endpoint

Change-Id: Ie678eeba1add193e7e1f506139ce21581d348beb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/05/207405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: app = middleware.HealthApp(app=app, path='/v1/health')

commit_message:
Add hook to translate exceptions into HTTP codes

Adds a hook to catch neutron exceptions and translate them into
a corresponding HTTP error code. If no corresponding code is found,
an HTTP 500 is returned with the original exception logged so
internal state isn't leaked to the user.

Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch
Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: Ia25733d6e394e034995890c806ed04e387d4ab58

commit_message:
SR-IOV: Fix SR-IOV agent to run ip link commands as root

Commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/155523/
remove the remaining root_helper args, but didn't
update the SR-IOV agent to execute them as root.

This patch updates the agent to execute ip link commands
as root and pass options argument as a list in the
self._as_root method.

(cherry picked from commit 991ea00e6c115343eabecc62e86072175823f81f)
Closes-Bug: #1479694
Change-Id: I53cafd61845a69fae3a759fb7526950d655ffa20
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/03/208003/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add startup hook after pecan init for plugins

Add a startup method to initialize all of the plugins after the
pecan app is configured but before it is returned to guaruntee
that everything is ready before the app starts taking requests.

Change-Id: Id18ac5ab979b5f2cb49b69d8650248010e02fe76
Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch

added_lines: from neutron.newapi import startup startup.initialize_all()

subject: Adds garp_master_repeat and garp_master_refresh to keepalived.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-29 11:32:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/2d02dcf51ec0537b26641ece61af5af34eec235e', 'message': 'Adds garp_master_repeat and garp_master_refresh to keepalived.conf

This patch aims to solve an issue when, in some cases, the L3 agent might
start before the OVS agent during a node boot process.
At such scenario, the L3 agent will configure the routers before the OVS agent
done syncing with the server and starts processing ovsdb monitor updates.

The result:
1. L3 agent finishes configuring an HA router
2. Keepalived spawned
3. In case of transition to master state, it (keepalived) sends gratuitous ARPs
                                                            ^---The issue
4. The OVS agent has just finished plugging its ports

Meaning, the gratuitous ARP will be lost, but the router acting as master.
Closes-Bug: #1453855

Change-Id: I2cffa7c0ebad20bd50396265aef9fcfa64018744
(cherry picked from commit 141560b4221b9b58fd34405a8f94e826f92f35ff)

commit_message:
Adds garp_master_repeat and garp_master_refresh to keepalived.conf

This patch aims to solve an issue when, in some cases, the L3 agent might
start before the OVS agent during a node boot process.
At such scenario, the L3 agent will configure the routers before the OVS agent
done syncing with the server and starts processing ovsdb monitor updates.

The result:
1. L3 agent finishes configuring an HA router
2. Keepalived spawned
3. In case of transition to master state, it (keepalived) sends gratuitous ARPs
                                                            ^---The issue
4. The OVS agent has just finished plugging its ports

Meaning, the gratuitous ARP will be lost, but the router acting as master.
Closes-Bug: #1453855

Change-Id: I2cffa7c0ebad20bd50396265aef9fcfa64018744
(cherry picked from commit 141560b4221b9b58fd34405a8f94e826f92f35ff)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/98/206998/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: garp_master_repeat 5 garp_master_refresh 10

commit_message:
Add keystone middleware wrapper to pecan app

Adds keystone middleware to enforce authentication if
auth_strategy is set to keystone.

Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch
Change-Id: I59a97579b1f2397597a127f02d00e99468f1e4a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/49/191049/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystonemiddleware import auth_token if cfg.CONF.auth_strategy: app = auth_token.AuthProtocol(app, {})

commit_message:
Add hiera, globals, and netconfig to keystone and db tasks

If keystone or database tasks get skipped, they get
executed before all hiera data and network configuration
is processed.

Change-Id: If18fee338534eeadf65aa357d37fbe18082ec5d8
Closes-Bug: #1478325

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-09 07:49:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/hyperv/agent/utilsv2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/hyperv/test_hyperv_utilsv2.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/57816ddc9e13052606364aa953caa438c4d60f0c', 'message': 'Fix for ICMP rule deletion

This fix is for Juno branch.
With the introduction stateful security rules a change to set localport
to empty for icmp is made during rule cration.
However during deletion also there should be a check to match the empty
localport field in case of icmp , since _filter_security_acls method
will not match the rule on hyperv network adapter extended acls which

Change-Id: I2e0f63de5bd5f94520544b43a041f127d6526d5b
Closes-Bug: #1470443
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for ICMP rule deletion

This fix is for Juno branch.
With the introduction stateful security rules a change to set localport
to empty for icmp is made during rule cration.
However during deletion also there should be a check to match the empty
localport field in case of icmp , since _filter_security_acls method
will not match the rule on hyperv network adapter extended acls which
results in icmp rule not getting deleted and traffic still flows.

Change-Id: I2e0f63de5bd5f94520544b43a041f127d6526d5b
Closes-Bug: #1470443
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/199932/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_filter_security_acls_icmp(self): default = self._utils._ACL_DEFAULT self._test_filter_security_acls_icmp( default, default, self._FAKE_REMOTE_ADDR) def _test_filter_security_acls_icmp(self, local_port, protocol, remote_addr): icmp_acls = [] for port, proto in [('', self._utils._ICMP_PROTOCOL), (local_port, protocol)]: mock_acl = mock.MagicMock() mock_acl.Action = self._utils._ACL_ACTION_ALLOW mock_acl.Direction = self._FAKE_ACL_DIR mock_acl.LocalPort = port mock_acl.Protocol = proto mock_acl.RemoteIPAddress = remote_addr icmp_acls.append(mock_acl) icmp_acl_empty_port = self._utils._filter_security_acls( icmp_acls, mock_acl.Action, self._FAKE_ACL_DIR, self._FAKE_ACL_TYPE, local_port, self._utils._ICMP_PROTOCOL, remote_addr) self.assertEqual(icmp_acl_empty_port[0].LocalPort, '')

commit_message:
qos: forbid creating rules when there is no access to policy

Change-Id: If06de416dfe0eb7115fd4be9feb461fae8e8358d
Partially-Implements: blueprint quantum-qos-api

commit_message:
Initial pecan structure

This patch is the initial work for the pecan refactor.

* Adds pecan as a requirement
* Adds a simple API server named 'neutron-dev-server' for use
  when neutron server is not deployed in a web server
* Wraps the app with the openstack request ID middleware
* Adds a basic V2 controller that breaks out requests by method
* Adds functional tests to ensure request ID is set and requests
  are properly sent to the V2 controller.

Partially-Implements: blueprint wsgi-pecan-switch
Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mark McClain <mark@mcclain.xyz>
Change-Id: Ic9697ff30ab8359b62ce01eb73dc927065a8e3e6

subject: Fix concurrent attaches on HNAS iSCSI driver

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-20 19:10:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/58f712c3a9e7ab8ea7ecfa2e2f7b385c7ac54227', 'message': 'Fix concurrent attaches on HNAS iSCSI driver

commit_message:
Fix concurrent attaches on HNAS iSCSI driver

It might happen that multiple cinder nodes/backends are trying to add
volumes to the same target. In this situation, the driver can get an
error trying to add a volume to a hlun just taken by other instance.
This patch fix this avoiding concurrency using mutual exclusion and adds
retries to the failed attempts to cover scenarios where multiple cinder
hosts are used.

Closes-bug: #1475007
Change-Id: Ie2d3b286eecbf0299ac0c0e32d3e098bb5d11e4f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/80/203780/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Set autodoc_index_modules=True so tox -e docs builds module docs again
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-07 21:14:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e59d87200db0163c720159e7b4e1d85b08122aa0', 'message': "Set autodoc_index_modules=True so tox -e docs builds module docs again

Commit bd7e62f796fe951fd42c2edad56e252a0b7393c8 disabled the
autodoc_index_modules flag for building docs but it wasn't really
necessary, that change was just to get the module index out of the main
docs page.

We want to autodoc the modules so we can view the actual module index in
the tox -d docs build results, which also tells us if we have correct
ReST format in doc strings.

Notes
-----

1. Several doc string blocks have to be fixed as part of this to get
   the docs tox job to pass.
2. A docstring in vhdutilsv2 is updated to remove the math directive

commit_message:
Set autodoc_index_modules=True so tox -e docs builds module docs again

Commit bd7e62f796fe951fd42c2edad56e252a0b7393c8 disabled the
autodoc_index_modules flag for building docs but it wasn't really
necessary, that change was just to get the module index out of the main
docs page.

We want to autodoc the modules so we can view the actual module index in
the tox -d docs build results, which also tells us if we have correct
ReST format in doc strings.

Notes
-----

1. Several doc string blocks have to be fixed as part of this to get
   the docs tox job to pass.
2. A docstring in vhdutilsv2 is updated to remove the math directive
   since that requires the sphinx.ext.pngmath extension which requires
   latex and dvipng packages from the distro - which is overkill for
   what the docstring was actually doing with the math directive.
3. We exclude autodoc for tests since we don't really care about
   docstrings on unit tests.
4. We exclude the nova.wsgi.nova-* modules since those won't build with
   autodoc since they can't be imported (there is no
   nova/wsgi/__init__.py module). We could arguably add the __init__.py
   but it's not really necessary for what those scripts are used for.
5. The sphinx.ext.ifconfig extension is removed since there are no docs
   that use the ifconfig directive.
6. Update the developer docs to explicitly point out that graphviz must
   be installed prior to running tox -e docs.
7. Hide doc/source/api/autoindex.rst from the toctree so that we don't
   regress the point of commit bd7e62f796fe951fd42c2edad56e252a0b7393c8.
8. unused_docs and exclude_trees options are removed from conf.py since
   they are deprecated in Sphinx 1.2.3:

   https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/blob/1.2.3/sphinx/config.py#L54
9. Fix imports for moved libvirt volume options.

Closes-Bug: #1471934

Change-Id: I946e2f89f2c9fc70e870faaf84e4a8b0fc703344
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/199297/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Have pbr generate the module indexes like sphinx autodoc autodoc_index_modules = True # Exclude modules that won't build with autodoc (or that we don't want doc'ed); # this requires updating the exclude_patterns variable in doc/source/conf.py autodoc_exclude_modules = nova.wsgi.nova-* nova.tests.* # Treat sphinx warnings as errors during the docs build; this helps us keep # the documentation clean.
